references.paper_title: Deep anomaly detection with outlier exposure
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of deep anomaly detection, providing a baseline for the task of OOD detection and influencing many subsequent works.
This paper introduced the variational autoencoder (VAE), a generative model heavily used in OOD detection methods for learning a compressed representation of in-distribution data.
This seminal work introduced Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), another generative model architecture relevant to OOD detection because of its ability to model complex data distributions.

references.paper_title: Denoising diffusion models for out-of-distribution detection
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the efficacy of diffusion models in OOD detection, inspiring the use of this technique in the current work.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This work details Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), a key technique leveraged by the authors for generating and reconstructing distorted feature representations, central to their proposed method.
